thread.title: Keuchel limits Royals as Astros win ALDS Game 3
thread.title_full: Keuchel limits Royals as Astros win ALDS Game 3

title: Keuchel limits Royals as Astros win ALDS Game 3
text:
Kansas City Royals first baseman Eric Hosmer strikes out swinging during the fifth inning of an ALDS baseball game on Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, at Minute Maid Park in Houston. (John Sleezer/Kansas City Star/TNS via Getty Images) HOUSTON, Texas (AP) - 
Dallas Keuchel remained perfect at home with seven gutsy innings and Chris Carter homered Sunday, leading the Houston Astros to a 4-2 win over the Kansas City Royals to take a 2-1 lead in the American League Division Series. 
The Astros could wrap up the best-of-five series with a win over the defending AL champions in Game 4 on Monday. 
Keuchel (2-0) worked out of jam after jam, allowing five hits and one run with seven strikeouts after going 15-0 at home this season, a modern major league record. 
Luke Gregerson gave up a leadoff homer in the ninth to Alex Gordon before finishing off the Astros first playoff game in Houston in 10 years with a four-out save. It was save of more than three outs in three years. 
Jason Castro drove in two runs with a single in the fifth that made it 2-1. Carlos Gomez, who has a rib muscle strain, started for the first time in the series and had an RBI single in the sixth. 
Copyright 2015, Schurz Communications
